title: Transfer of partner's transferable interest
context: [ยง425E-702] Transfer of partner&rsquo;s transferable interest.**** (a) A transfer, in whole or in part, of a partner&rsquo;s transferable interest: (1) Is permissible; (2) Shall not by itself cause the partner&rsquo;s dissociation or a dissolution and winding up of the limited partnership&rsquo;s activities; and (3) Shall not, as against the other partners or the limited partnership, entitle the transferee to participate in the management or conduct of the limited partnership&rsquo;s activities, to require access to information concerning the limited partnership&rsquo;s transactions except as otherwise provided in subsection &copy;, or to inspect or copy the required information or the limited partnership&rsquo;s other records. (b) A transferee has a right to receive, in accordance with the transfer: (1) Distributions to which the transferor would otherwise be entitled; and (2) Upon the dissolution and winding up of the limited partnership&rsquo;s activities the net amount otherwise distributable to the transferor. &copy; In a dissolution and winding up, a transferee shall be entitled to an account of the limited partnership&rsquo;s transactions only from the date of dissolution. (d) Upon transfer, the transferor retains the rights of a partner other than the interest in distributions transferred and retains all duties and obligations of a partner. (e) A limited partnership need not give effect to a transferee&rsquo;s rights under this section until the limited partnership has notice of the transfer. (f) A transfer of a partner&rsquo;s transferable interest in the limited partnership in violation of a restriction on transfer contained in the partnership agreement shall be ineffective as to a person having notice of the restriction at the time of transfer. (g) A transferee that becomes a partner with respect to a transferable interest shall be liable for the transferor&rsquo;s obligations under sections 425E-502 and 425E-509. However, the transferee shall not be liable for obligations unknown to the transferee at the time the transferee became a partner. [L 2003, c 210, pt of ยง1]
